title: Caral The First Civilization in America - Full Day From Lima
description: Beat the crowds and visit a lesser known—but no less fascinating—Inca archeological site on a day trip from Lima. As well as receiving personalized attention in a small group limited to 10 people, you’ll gain local perspective and history that you may miss if exploring the ruins on your own.
all_descriptions: Beat the crowds and visit a lesser known—but no less fascinating—Inca archeological site on a day trip from Lima. As well as receiving personalized attention in a small group limited to 10 people, you’ll gain local perspective and history that you may miss if exploring the ruins on your own.

After being picked up from your central Lima hotel in time for a 7am departure, set out on the around 3-hour journey to the Caral Archaeological Site. On arrival, follow your guide around the vast 148-acre (60-hectare) site in the arid Supe Valley and marvel at the elaborate complex of temples, sunken plazas, and terraced pyramids, some of which rank among the largest in the world.

 Along the way, learn more about the fascinating history of the ancient settlement, which was first inhabited between 2600 BCE and 2000 BCE, and hear why some archeologists believe that Caral is the fabled ‘Mother City’ of ancient civilizations in the Americas.

 On return to Lima, your tour ends with drop-off back at your hotel.
Av. José Larco 724, Miraflores 15074, PeruDear client, if you don't want pick up, you can meet us at our office located at Av. Jose Larco 724, Miraflores.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.

The perfect day trip from Lima with great guides and drivers.

Aug 2025 • Family
Amazing experience! We did the private family tour to Caral and our guide Stefano and driver Julio were very knowledgable and welcoming. They knew great places to stop and eat and how to specify the tour to what we were looking for. English option was also appreciated. Highly recommend.
Written August 28, 2025

12 contributions

caral remote but worth a visit

Mar 2025 • Family
JJ the guide was amazing and very knowledgable, and we really appreciated all of his explanations throughout the entire tour of not just Caral but also the history of the development of the areas we drove through including Chivay and Lima's outer "ghettos" . He also gave some context on past and current issues these places are facing today, which was both interesting and helpful to stave off boredom on what was an incredibly long drive (5-5.5hrs each way).

Caral clearly does not get many visitors; we went on a Saturday and saw 2 other groups the whole time. You have to get a guide at the front (as with many places in Peru) but they did not have any English speaking guides, so JJ was also invaluable for providing information for us and helping with translating when we had questions for him/the Spanish-speaking guide. I appreciate that Caral hires all locals from the area who have been helping with the site for a very long time. Also, we learned that there is a lot more to the area than just Caral - they're working through 18 other archaeological sites in the area that are related!

The driving was very safe but the van's speed was throttled to what seemed to be quite slow and I didn't understand why. It felt like we could have gotten to Caral and back much faster going just a bit faster, although the traffic was also brutal. It also would have been nice to know the drive could take so long - on the itinerary it was listed as a 3.5-4hr drive. Also, as it was during wet season one of the road crossings had the river coursing across it so we took an alternative route that involved a tuktuk which was quite fun but something to keep in mind!

Ultimately we really enjoyed this chance to see such a unique and ancient site, and I don't think it would have been possible to do so with my non-Spanish speaking family without a tour like this. I can see why people don't visit given the long journey (there are not really any tourist sites in between to break it up) but I think going at least once is important.

Finally, communication with the booking person was also great, the person answered all our questions quickly.
Written March 9, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Bernalillo, NM9 contributions

Dino, the guide, was excellent. He answered all my questions. And he was so passionate about his work. The weather was p

Leonardo knows his country and told the two us so many things on the four hour ride from Lima to Caral. The traffic was heavy but the time went fast with all the conversation. When we got to Caral, our site guide was Dino who was passionate about the site and had worked as an archeologist on the site for twenty five years . The exhibits were great but you need to know Spanish to read them of course. However, Leonardo was quick to talk about them. We had Lomo soltando in Huacho with chicha. The weather was perfect. Our driver, Alexandro, was a great driver as I would not like to navigate Lima!
Written December 28, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

reviews.title: A Pleasant Experience
reviews.text: The guide was professional, responsive, knowledgeable, and amiable - what more can one desire from a one-day tour! The driving was safe, friendly, and bearing the travelers in mind.

reviews.title: Buenas vibras all around
reviews.text: Caral is a relatively new discovery and an excavation in progress. The present ruins are magnificent, but I came away so excited about what’s yet to be uncovered. Our guide, Nataly, is someone with a deep love of history and archeology, and her enthusiasm was contagious. The car ride to Caral is long, but Nataly kept us entertained with her knowledge of Peru, archeological, historical, cultural, gastronomical… she provided great insight into everything! Our driver, Isahir, was very accommodating, kind, and a lovely person to spend the day with. We all had an awesome day and learned a lot.

reviews.title: Don't forget hat and sunscreen!
reviews.text: The walk with Caesar and Louis was fabulous.Not only were they very friendly and attentive in the trip to the destination, but both went beyond the ordinary to explain the local particularities and recommend the spaces to visit in Lima and Peru.The site itself is very interesting and gives an account of the life that in the past there manifested itself, highlighting the structures there found in a very special way.

reviews.title: The Perfect Start to Our Trip
reviews.text: This trip was fabulous. We learned so much about the history and geography of Peru - not only while at Caral - but on the journey to Caral and back to Lima. Amadeo was a wealth of knowledge and happy to answer every question. It was the perfect way to start our trip.

reviews.title: Great tour with an excellent operator. Highly recommend it.
reviews.text: Booking with HAKU through Trip Advisor was very straightforward. They offer reserve now - pay later option. Our trip was on August 19, 2024 for which I made the reservation early in August, but they deferred the charge to my card till August 17, with free cancellation prior to that. We were in a group of six, four of us and two others. They picked us up at 5:45 am from our hotel in Mira Flores in a passenger van with a driver and a guide- JJ or Joel Jr. was the guide. JJ is very knowledgeable, polite, and professional, and spoke fluent English. He made the long drive very enjoyable, telling us history of Peru, its people, and culture. It took 4.5 hrs to get to Caral and 5 hrs on the return. We spent about 2.5 hrs visiting the ruins at Caral. It turned out to be a long day - we got back to the hotel around 7:00 pm because the traffic in the city was bad. Overall we are glad we went to see the oldest known cradle of civilization. Highly recommend HAKU and kudos to JJ. Thank you HAKU.

reviews.title: Fabulous day trip to amazing archeological site!
reviews.text: We had a wonderful full day tour of Caral! Our driver was great. Our guide Leonardo was excellent, he spoke perfect English, knew the history in great detail of the area and introduced us to the head archeologist of Caral and translated for us. He made sure we were comfortable and was very professional. Can't speak highly enough of our experience!

reviews.title: Hidden Gem for history fanatics
reviews.text: Caral is a hidden gem. You get to see the oldest society (predates Egypt) in Americas. It's about 4 hour car ride from Lima so doable as a day trip. It's still an active excavation site so they are still discovering new information about the site.Saul was our guide and Alejandro was our driver. They were both delightful and fluent in English. Saul shared so much information about Peru culture as we pass by different districts. We stopped for local breakfast and lunch (after the site tour). they were both authentic.Once we get to the site, it is led by the official culture department guide and Saul acted as our translator and added colors based on his past experiences. It's an amazing experience to be on a site that was built 5000 years ago and learning about the architecture and the culture. The designs of the architecture was so sturdy that it withstood earthquakes and flooding.Lima traffic is quite crazy so be prepared to be a bit delayed coming back to the city. The car they picked us up in is a roomy Honda with automatic transmission which makes the long ride smoother.
